intro: Amyema anisomeres, commonly known as the variable amyema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Amyema anisomeres is known for its variable morphology, which can make it challenging to identify without careful examination. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
